div.opener:
LEIPZIG!!
July 28th 77
Something Hotel. I didn’t catch the name. 11. am.
div.p:
My darling Mother! All ideas are flown & I am mentally wallowing in one thought & one only i.e. "Here I am"!! And I have only just begun to realise that fact – For them we made a brave resolution and left Rotterdam at 4 p.m. yesterday travelling straight through to this place which we reached at 8.30 this morning! A good long spell of it! but we both slept like tops -
Tho' although
, that being the only fast train from Hanover, the carriage was too full to admit of lying down - Yet, I don’t even feel stiff! nor I believe does Harry who probably will speak for himself ere I close There this –
tho’ although
at present he is wandering about. Dear Thekla met us at the station and we promised to be at her mother’s at 12. I will then get the aunt’s address and tell you what it is (if possible) in this letter or an the envelope. Harry & I on our arrival here made elaborate toilettes & at down with gest to
Kaffee & Brödchen – (
Tho' Although
we had gone
thro’ through
the same performance at ½ past 5 this morning at Magdeburg) & I have just come in from a prowl about town. Of course I at once repaired to the Conservatorium & gazed at that most gloomy edifice with feelings easier imagined than described,
tho’ although
somewhat modified by the fact that we were not "cock-sure" which of 7 or 8 gloomy buildings edifices in the block was actually
the
Conservatorium
(as the latter joins the University & is much the same style of building). There were a good massy "Studenten" strolling about – with very
festive hats caps & less festive – not to say stodgy – casts of countenance. Most of them wear spectacles all wear trousers that bag at the knee - & not a few are decorated with interesting cuts on their faces. These latter swagger a good deal. I've then repaired to the public gardens where I saw what my eyes had often pictured to me – The masses of chains round little tables – the trees - & in the midst the raised orchestra with desks all around!!. I see Egmont is to be played tonight at the theatre. I wonder if we shall go. Harry thinks it is time to repair to Leibnitzstrasse so I will close this for the present.
2)
Later
I find the post doesn’t go till 8.30 so can add the rest of my experiences so far. I went to the Friedländers & am charmed with them – one & all. The Frau seems a jolly cordial old person – & Marie the other sister a charming face & manner – both uglier
than Thekla I think! She latter walked with Harry & me to the aunt's – who is jolly too, & fat. Whereas my Frau is thin. There are three other lodges besides myself at the aunt’s & it will be fun I suspect as she doesn’t speak one word of English!! By the bye I must write down her address for I shall be there till Thursday next
bei Frau Heimbach
Leipzig
An der Pleisse
3.a
On second thoughts
tho’ although
if any letter arrives before Thursday at the Friedländers address it will be forwarded to me at the aunt’s (it’s only a 100 yards off) – if after Thursday (as I don’t yet know our address at the Thuringer Wald – besides
wh. where
we shall stop at Halle en route & not reach the J.W.
till Sat 7) The letter is sures to be forwarded from the Friedländers then from Fr. Heimbach's. So it
w_ d
would
be better to write there. It’s hot here
tho’ although
there’s no sun & a few drops of rain have fallen. Sure one a foretaste of what it
w_ d
would
be when the weather is bona fide hot! I suspect you will forward this to dear old Mary to whom I shan’t write till I’ve something to tell. My dear love to her & 1000 thanks for her sweet letter. Rederer is engaged to Dr. Semon !!!!
